title: Opting out of Mozilla's online advertising campaign
content:
I recently read Mozilla CEO Laura Chambers' blog post titled "Improving Online Advertising Through Product and Infrastructure" dated October 3, 2024. I understand that Mozilla is introducing new advertising solutions within products like Firefox and Fakespot, focusing on privacy-preserving techniques and partnerships with Anonym.

While I appreciate Mozilla's commitment to user privacy and innovation in the advertising space, I prefer not to participate in any form of advertising integration within my browser or other Mozilla products.

Does the community have a voice or choice in the matter? Could anyone guide me on how to opt out of these new advertising features or disable them entirely? Or is my only option moving to another browser? I value the control over my online experience and would greatly appreciate any assistance or recommendations the community can provide.
creator: hajimari

title: Ripristino schede aprte della sessione precedente
content: Se Firefox tengo diverse schede aperte, di cui infaatti ho l'impostazione di riaprire all'avvio l'ultima sessione. Il problema è che se capita, a causa di un qualunque processo, mentre Firefox è chiuso, che si apre una sola finestra, poi non è più possibile ripristinare la precedente sessione con le numerose schede aperte che potevo vedere fino a prima (cosa possibile su Edge). Ho provato anche a seguire le vostre istruzioni di ripristino sessione precedente, ma credo siano vecchie o legate ad un'altra variante perché non esiste quella opzione (vedi foto). Potreste fornirmi una soluzione definitiva in merito per favore? Io uso Firefox 131.0 (64 bit), cioè l'ultima versione.

title: Firefox problems: wrong login details & incorrect text on sites
content:
When clicking on a site in Firefox for me, the text is OK just like on the registration tab - see example 1. The text is as follows: Meteen na je registratie kan je je ticket(s) downloaden en ontvang je een bevestigingsmail. Kinderen t.e.m. 16 jaar krijgen gratis toegang, als ze vergezeld zijn door een volwassene met een geldig ticket.

When a friend of mine clicks on this site, he sees the correct text, but in a split second the following text appears: Meteen na je registratie kan je ticket(s ontvang) download en je een bevestigingmail. Kinderen t.e.m. 16 jaar geleden 16 jaar geleden 16 jaar geleden. The text on the registration tab is also wrong - see example 2.

When logging in to some site, the email address is OK for me, but for certain people it goes completely wrong. In a split second they see the CORRECT email address, but everything goes wrong!!! See my example 3. For the Outlook account Firefox does NOT put @ but a - (minus sign) and for a Gmail account Firefox does NOT put @ but a . (period) and the name of that account is far from correct!!! This should be guido, and what does it say: guiduidobo???

Note: BOTH login details are CORRECTLY displayed in the saved WW. Already removed all caches etc. - started without extensions etc... but this problem persists for those involved! We all work with Windows 10 and Firefox is fully up to date. There is seriously something wrong in Firefox, know that for these 3 points everything is OK in Google Chrome - Edge! Please investigate this thoroughly. Thanks in advance for the necessary effort.
creator: SpeedyKepke

title: Download not working on ubuntu 22
content:
Hi! I'm running latest Firefox on ubuntu 22. Downloading stopped working all the sudden. I download and print pdfs as part of my daily work, and first I thought this was an printing issue, but it turns out to be download related. I deleted snap version of fw and installed ppa version (since snap had all-ready problems with file destinations), refreshed fw, reset-ed download folders etc from about.config, started fw in safe mode, added pages I usually use to the list with no secure browsing and nothing helped. When I click some file to download, it hangs up in download dialog, and I'm also unable ti clear the list, or cancel download. When I reboot fw, and it reloads previous session, downloaded file appears, and I'm able to print this file, but no other after that one.

Thank You in advance! - Ari Luokkala

title: PDF Handling in Firefox vs. Chrome
content:
Hello,

I recently switched from Google Chrome to Firefox, and I’m having trouble with how PDFs are handled. When I click on a link for a PDF, I see the PDF symbol indicating it can be opened or downloaded based on my preferences. However, I want PDFs to download directly without opening when I click a download button, similar to Chrome’s default behavior.

In Chrome, if I click a link to view a PDF, it opens in the browser. But if I click a download button, it downloads without opening. I’d like to achieve the same in Firefox: view PDFs when I click a link but download them directly when I click a download button.

Thank you for your help!

title: How can I prevent Firefox from opening PDFs sent as attachments, but keep previewing when inline?
content:
I want to be able to view inline PDFs in the browser, and download PDFs sent as attachments, without opening them in Firefox. I've searched the forum, tried different combinations of download settings and toggling `browser.download.open_pdf_attachments_inline` but no dice, either Firefox downloads every file (inline or attached), or it opens the local file in the browser.

I respect that the PDF viewer in Firefox is great, and I want to keep using it when I choose. Right now, I have a download progress that pops up, then the browser becomes unresponsive and switches to the new tab, which is disrupting.

Seems simple but how can I have the following behaviour? - Inline PDF -> view in browser - Attachment -> download without opening in browser

title: can't sync multiple profiles?
content:
I have what i am sure is a common scenario, a work pc (mac) and home pc (linux), and I want to have a work profile and home profile that are independently synced across those PCs.

It's no problem to setup sync for the work profile but while setting up sync for the home profile it seems firefox doesn't grok that the home profile already exists and treats it like a new mozilla account.

In debugging this issue (and the "Primary account email required for sign-in" issue, which prevented me from signing in at all) i've come across numerous articles that imply this basic home<->home work<->work sync across 2 devices does not work with firefox. Is this the case? this is a basic (IMO mandatory) requirement for a browser in 2024 and even the difficulty of setting this up is super jarring coming from Chrome.

content: I have 2 rows of Shortcuts selected & I can see the "Shortcut Icon or Favicon", however one of them is still showing an old one for a website & I know that the site actually have a new Favicon displayed. Why am I still seeing the old one? Is there a way to refresh my page so I see the new one? Any help greatly appreciated.

title: Document Expired - The requested document is not available in Firefox’s cache.
content:
Your present published results do not solve the problem.

Why, when I try to go back to a duckduckgo.com page, do I get this message and how do I resolve the issue? What makes duckduckgo a sensitive document? This started recently. I had no issues before.

Document Expired This document is no longer available. The requested document is not available in Firefox’s cache. 

   As a security precaution, Firefox does not automatically re-request sensitive documents.    Click Try Again to re-request the document from the website.
